Package task3.implementation

Class ChannelImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • task3.specification.Channel
      • task3.implementation.ChannelImpl
  • public class ChannelImpl
extends Channel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ChannelImpl​(CircularBuffer receptionBuffer, CircularBuffer emissionBuffer, Rdv rdv)  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void disconnect()
      disconnect from current connection (if connected) Note that if user requested to disconnect while reading/writing on the channel, the channel will wait until the current job finish before disconnecting, but if user check status it will appear as disconnected and no new jobs will be accepted (read and write requests will return -1)
      boolean disconnected()
      Send a boolean evaluating true if connection is disconnected, and false if a connection is currently running
      void halfDisconnect()  
      int read​(byte[] bytes, int offset, int length)
      This function reads the given length from Channel.
      int write​(byte[] bytes, int offset, int length)
      Sends a stream of bytes given an array a length of bytes to send and an offset Note : if length given is bigger than the array range, then only available range will be sent

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • write

        public int write​(byte[] bytes,
                 int offset,
                 int length)
          throws DisconnectedException
        Description copied from class: Channel
        Sends a stream of bytes given an array a length of bytes to send and an offset Note : if length given is bigger than the array range, then only available range will be sent
        Overrides:
        write in class Channel
        Parameters:
        bytes - is the array of bytes
        offset - where to start sending
        length - length of data to send
        Returns:
        Number of bytes sent successfully, -1 if an error occurred

        DisconnectedException

      • read

        public int read​(byte[] bytes,
                int offset,
                int length)
         throws DisconnectedException
        Description copied from class: Channel
        This function reads the given length from Channel. Note: this function is blocking function, meaning that it could block the thread in case if given length not read yet.
        Overrides:
        read in class Channel
        Parameters:
        bytes - byte array to store values into
        offset - offset where to start storing
        length - length of data to be read
        Returns:
        n number of bytes that have been read, -1 if error occurred
        Throws:
        DisconnectedException

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Description copied from class: Channel
        disconnect from current connection (if connected) Note that if user requested to disconnect while reading/writing on the channel, the channel will wait until the current job finish before disconnecting, but if user check status it will appear as disconnected and no new jobs will be accepted (read and write requests will return -1)
        Overrides:
        disconnect in class Channel

      • disconnected

        public boolean disconnected()
        Description copied from class: Channel
        Send a boolean evaluating true if connection is disconnected, and false if a connection is currently running
        Overrides:
        disconnected in class Channel
        Returns:
        boolean disconnected or not
